page.title: 17The Warren,Kirkby
page.content: On 14th June a group of children went on a nature survey to an area known as "The Warren".This survey was to look for animals,birds,insects,flowers, bushes and trees.Many of the things found could not be identified so a few samples were collected and taken back to school.Later some were examined under a microscope. At the "Warren" are open fields, sandstone banks,an old railway line with filled-in tunnel,woods and a footpath. We saw oak,beech,Scots Pine and Silver Birch trees,gorse,wild rose elderberry and hawthorn bushes.Flowers included bluebell,buttercup and dande- lion. We saw racing and wood pigeons, starlings,sparrows and swifts,a dead shrew,rabbit,horses and dogs.We also saw bees,spiders and a dragonfly. Robin Hood's Cave is now filled up with sand.
